string.name: wp_home_menu_pull_to_dismiss
string.context: This is a message that slowly fades in when swiping down on a scrolling menu indicating that if the user scrolls down far enough, the menu will disappear and reveal the prior screen

resources.string: Balayer l\'écran vers le bas pour ignorer

string.name: wp_home_menu_search_the_menu
string.context: This is a placeholder message in a search field (that disappears when entering the field) telling the user that the search can be used to filter down the list of menu options that are below the search box (as opposed to, say, searching everything about mychart)

string.name: wp_home_menu_cancel_menu
string.context: This is displayed next to the search bar to cancel the search or close the menu

string.name: wp_home_feed_button_reload
string.context: This is displayed on the error card's button in order to reload the feed

plurals.name: wp_home_menu_search_results_found
plurals.context: This is displayed when the menu search has results. %1$@ is the number of results

string.name: wp_home_menu_search_no_results_found
string.context: This is displayed if the search has no results for menu

string.name: wp_home_menu
string.context: The button name for the menu

string.name: wp_home_search_placeholder
string.context: Text displayed in the search bar that encourages the user to search

string.name: wp_home_sayt_window_accessibility
string.context: Accessibility target for the iOS search window when showing search-as-you-type

string.name: wp_home_search_window_accessibility
string.context: Accessibility target for the iOS search window when showing search results

string.name: wp_home_header_logout
string.context: See STR_SPRING_POPDOWN_LOGOUT_TITLE; This is displayed as a button or table row indicating that tapping will log the user out and return to the login screen

string.name: wp_home_header_select_from_feature_options
string.context: This is displayed as a label above a table with rows of actionable menu options. These options can include Personalize, Settings, and Log out

resources.string: Veuillez sélectionner parmi les options suivantes:

string.name: wp_home_header_select_an_account
string.context: This is displayed as a header label if the logged in user has no patient record, but does have access to patients as proxy subjects. The user's name/photo appears selectable alongside the other selectable proxy subject patients, so while we might otherwise typically say 'select a patient to view,' since the user herself isn't a patient, we use the word 'account' instead, referring to a mychart account

string.name: wp_home_header_select_a_patient
string.context: This is displayed as a header label if the logged in user is a patient and has proxy subjects as well. The user's name/photo appears selectable alongside the other selectable proxy subject patients, and this label indicates the user should chose among them

string.name: wp_home_header_switch_accounts
string.context: Similiar to wp_home_header_select_an_account, this is displayed as a header label if the logged if the logged in user has no patient record, but does have access to patients as proxy subjects. The user's name/photo appears selectable alongside the other selectable proxy subject patients in a miniature form factor, and this label indicates that if the user taps the photos, they will be given a screen where they may switch to a different account.

string.name: wp_home_header_switch_patients
string.context: Similiar to wp_home_header_select_a_patient, this is displayed as a header label if the logged in user is a patient and has proxy subjects as well. The user's name/photo appears selectable alongside the other selectable proxy subject patients in a miniature form factor, and this label indicates that if the user taps the photos, they will be given a screen where they may switch to a different patient.

string.name: wp_home_header_welcome
string.context: Brief message welcoming the user, when we don't know their name

string.name: wp_home_header_welcome_with_name
string.context: Brief message welcoming the user, when we know their preferred name. %1$@ is the name of the user

string.name: wp_home_header_welcome_with_proxy
string.context: Brief message welcoming the user and informing them which chart they're viewing. %1$@ is the name of the proxy subject

string.name: wp_feed_view_pager_page_count
string.context: This text is read aloud before the voice over user begins swiping through the cards showing various cards. %1$@ is the number of cards that are in the carouesel

string.name: wp_feed_organization_name_hint
string.context: This is after the contents of an alert to indicate the information is coming from another organization via happy together. %1$@ is the default accessibility string and %2$@ is the org name

string.name: wp_home_header_switch_accounts_accessibility
string.context: This is the equivalent of wp_home_header_switch_accounts that is read aloud from screen readers instead.

resources.string: Changer de compte ou choisir parmi d\'autres options de compte.

string.name: wp_home_header_switch_patients_accessibility
string.context: This is the equivalent of wp_home_header_patients_accounts that is read aloud from screen readers instead. %1$@ will be either Switch Patients, Switch Persons, or similar action.

resources.string: %1$@ ou choisir parmi d\'autres options de compte.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_welcome
string.context: Accessibility Message after login. Where %1$@ is the name of the user. And %2$@ is the brand name. Example brand names would be MyChart, MyHealth, Org Patient Portal.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_clear_search
string.context: Accessibility Message when focusing on the clear search button.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_closed_menu
string.context: Accessibility Message after closing them menu pop up.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_menu_group
string.context: Accessibility Message when focusing on a menu sub header.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_viewing_chart
string.context: Accessibility Message when focusing on a image showing whose chart you are viewing.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_menu_opening
string.context: Accessibility Message while opening the menu pop up.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_viewing_chart_single
string.context: Accessibility Message when focusing on a image showing whose chart you are viewing. Tapping the image will show account options. Only for a single patient with no proxy subjects. %1$@ is the name of the user.

resources.string: Affichage du dossier pour %1$@. Options de compte.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_select_patient_or_cancel
string.context: Accessibility Message instructing users to select from a list of patients or tap to go back to where they came from close the current window. The text should closely resemble wp_home_header_select_patient

resources.string: Sélectionner un patient à afficher ou appuyer deux fois pour annuler.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_select_account_or_cancel
string.context: Accessibility Message instructing users to select from a list of patients or tap to go back to where they came from close the current window. The text should closely resemble wp_home_header_select_account

resources.string: Sélectionner un compte à afficher ou appuyer deux fois pour annuler.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_select_option_or_cancel
string.context: Accessibility Message instructing users to select from a list of account features or tap to go back to where they came from close the current window. The text should closely resemble wp_home_header_select_from_feature_options

resources.string: Sélectionner parmi les options suivantes ou appuyer deux fois pour annuler.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_view_all_menu_options
string.context: Accessibility label for the main menu button, indicating that tapping will show every navigation option available. Used when the patient is viewing their own chart and they do not have any proxies

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_view_all_menu_options_self_with_proxies
string.context: Accessibility label for the main menu button, indicating that tapping will show every navigation option available. Used when the patient is viewing their own chart, but they also have proxies

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_view_all_menu_options_proxy
string.context: Accessibility label for the main menu button, indicating that tapping will show every navigation option available for the currently selected patient. Used when the patient is viewing their proxy's chart. %1$@ - The proxy name

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_open_search_activity
string.context: Accessibility label for the button that opens the search activity

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_close_search_activity
string.context: Accessibility label for the button that closes the search activity

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_feed_header_text_empty
string.context: Accessibility label for each a header section of the notifications table informing the user that the patient (named %1$@) associated with this heading has no notifications to follow that header.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_feed_header_text_empty_self
string.context: Accessibility label for each a header section of the notifications table informing the user that they have no notifications to follow this header.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_myc3_progress_arc
string.context: Accessibility text for the progress arc that shows the percentage of finished MyChart Care Companion tasks due today.

plurals.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_feed_header_text
plurals.context: Accessibility label for each header section of the notifications table informing the user that the patient (named %2$@) associated with this heading has %1$@ notifications in the rows that follow that header.

plurals.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_feed_header_text_self
plurals.context: Accessibility label for the header section of the notifications table for users with no proxy subjects, informing the user they have %1$@ notifications in the rows that follow that header.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_proxy_selection_currently_selected
string.context: Accessibility label telling the user that the patient who has accessibility focus is the currently selected patient/chart. %1$@ is the patient's name

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_proxy_selection_connection_error
string.context: Accessibility label telling the user that the patient who has accessibility focus has no information available from connected organizations. %1$@ is the patient's name

resources.string: %1$@. Avertissement: nous ne pouvons joindre aucun établissement connecté à %1$@.

string.name: wp_homepage_accessibility_proxy_selection_currently_selected_connection_error
string.context: Accessibility label telling the user that the patient who has accessibility focus is the currently selected patient/chart and has no information available from connected organizations. %1$@ is the patient's name

resources.string: %1$@, actuellement sélectionné(e). Avertissement: nous ne pouvons joindre aucun établissement connecté à %1$@.

string.name: wp_switch_organizations_feature
string.context: Text for the switch organization button that takes user to the list of their selected organizations

string.name: wp_family_access_feature
string.context: Text for the Friends and Family Access button on the proxy drop down window

string.name: wp_home_loading_text
string.context: This is the loading message for loading the users feed

resources.string: Vos informations sont en cours de préparation

string.name: wp_home_zero_state_title
string.context: This is the title message for the zero state card in the user feed

string.name: wp_home_feed_error_title
string.context: This is the error title if the feed can not be loaded

string.name: wp_home_feed_h2g_toast_error
string.context: Error message shown at the bottom of the screen when the feed was unable to load data from a happy together organization.

resources.string: Nous rencontrons des difficultés à nous connecter à vos comptes liés. Veuillez réessayer plus tard.

plurals.name: wp_home_feed_h2g_error_title
plurals.context: Error message shown at the bottom of the screen when the feed was unable to load data from a happy together organization
plurals.item: Compte avec des problèmes de connexion:
Comptes avec des problèmes de connexion:

string.name: wp_home_remember_my_choice
string.context: This is a message associated with a checkbox/switch that informs users that, if checked, MyChart will remember who they select and automatically make the same selection on subsequent logins.

string.name: wp_home_remember_my_choice_description
string.context: This is a description associated with the checkbox/switch that informs users that, if checked, MyChart will remember who they select and automatically make the same selection on subsequent logins. The description reminds users that they can change this selection later via Account Settings.

resources.string: Vous pourrez le modifier ultérieurement dans les Paramètres du compte.

string.name: wp_home_select_patient_subheader
string.context: This is displayed below the header to select a patient or account to view. This is a sub header explaining you can change later. %1$@ is either 'Switch Patients' or 'Switch Account' based on your account type.

resources.string: Utiliser le bouton %1$@ pour changer n\'importe quand.

string.name: wp_home_choose_someone_to_begin
string.context: This is displayed when a user with proxy subjects logs in and immediately faced with a selection screen of patients/accounts to select from. It should be inviting, since it's the opening screen.

string.name: wp_homepage_todo_summary_completed
string.context: Used on the To Do Summary card above the completion percentage

string.name: wp_homepage_todo_changes_clinic_contacted
string.context: Used on the To Do Changes card for when the clinic was contacted due to an escalation

resources.string: Votre établissement de soins a été contacté

string.name: wp_homepage_todo_changes_pcp_contacted
string.context: Used on the To Do Changes card for when the primary care provider was contacted due to an escalation

resources.string: Votre prestataire de soins a été contacté

string.name: wp_home_feed_pregnancyhub_stopalert_title
string.context: This text appears in an alert pop-up which appears when the user selects a button on the pregnancy progress update card which is intended for stopping updates. This is the title text of that alert dialogue.

resources.string: Arrêter les mises à jour sur la grossesse

string.name: wp_home_feed_pregnancyhub_stopalert_msg
string.context: This text appears in an alert pop-up which appears when the user selects a button on the pregnancy progress update card which is intended for stopping updates. This is the body text of that alert dialogue.

resources.string: Impossible d\'annuler cette modification. Êtes-vous sûr(e) de vouloir arrêter de recevoir des mises à jour sur la grossesse sur votre page d\'accueil et arrêter de recevoir des ressources éducatives sur la grossesse?

string.name: wp_home_feed_pregnancyhub_stopalert_msg_nocareplan
string.context: This text appears in an alert pop-up which appears when the user selects a button on the pregnancy progress update card which is intended for stopping updates. This is the body text of that alert dialogue.

resources.string: Impossible d\'annuler cette modification. Êtes-vous sûr(e) de vouloir arrêter de recevoir des mises à jour sur la grossesse sur votre page d\'accueil?

string.name: wp_home_feed_pregnancyhub_stopalert_confirm
string.context: This text appears in an alert pop-up which appears when the user selects a button on the pregnancy progress update card which is intended for stopping updates. This is the postive action button, which confirms the user's desire to stop updates.

string.name: wp_home_feed_pregnancyhub_stopalert_cancel
string.context: This text appears in an alert pop-up which appears when the user selects a button on the pregnancy progress update card which is intended for stopping updates. This is the cancel button text, which will just close out of the alert.

plurals.name: wp_home_feed_todo_genpattask_label
plurals.context: Label for general/patient-created tasks for the summary feed card

plurals.name: wp_home_feed_todo_medicationtask_label
plurals.context: Label for medication tasks for the summary feed card

plurals.name: wp_home_feed_todo_questionnairetask_label
plurals.context: Label for questionnaire tasks for the summary feed card

plurals.name: wp_home_feed_todo_educationtask_label
plurals.context: Label for education tasks for the summary feed card

plurals.name: wp_home_feed_todo_flowsheettask_label
plurals.context: Label for health-tracking tasks for the summary feed card

plurals.name: wp_home_feed_todo_appointmenttask_label
plurals.context: Label for appointment tasks for the summary feed card

string.name: wp_home_remote_proxies_lost_access_toast
string.context: Toast displayed when we have lost access a given person. %1$@ is the person's nickname.

string.name: wp_home_remote_proxies_lost_access_popup_title
string.context: Title for popup displayed when we have lost proxy access a given person.

string.name: wp_home_remote_proxies_lost_access_popup_content
string.context: Content for popup displayed when we have lost proxy access a given person. %1$@ is the person's nickname.

resources.string: Vous n\'avez maintenant accès à %1$@ dans aucun de vos établissements connectés.

string.name: wp_home_remote_proxies_connection_error
string.context: Toast displayed when we cannot reach any organizations providing information for a given person. %1$@ is the person's nickname.

resources.string: Nous ne pouvons joindre aucun établissement connecté à %1$@.

string.name: wp_home_remote_proxies_feature_error_card_title
string.context: Title for health feed error card that displays when we cannot reach any organizations providing information about a given person. %1$@ is the person's nickname.

resources.string: Le fil d\'actualités santé pour %1$@ est indisponible pour le moment.

string.name: wp_home_onboarding_welcome_header
string.context: Header label for the welcome page of the Home Page onboarding. %1$@ is the organization name.

string.name: wp_home_onboarding_welcome_title
string.context: This is the title of the onboarding welcome screen. %1$@ is the proxy subject's nickname

string.name: wp_home_onboarding_welcome_description
string.context: This is the description text on the onboarding welcome screen.

resources.string: Nous allons vous montrer quelques fonctionnalités qui vous aideront à trouver ce qui est le plus important pour vous.

string.name: wp_shortcut_personalization_title_self
string.context: Title used for Shortcut Personalization activity when accessing yourself

string.name: wp_shortcut_personalization_title_proxy
string.context: Title used for Shortcut Personalization activity when accessing a proxy subject. %1$@ is the proxy subject's nickname

string.name: wp_home_feed_unspecified_error
string.context: Critical error message when something went wrong with the app attempting to do what the user intended

resources.string: Nous rencontrons des problèmes pour traiter votre demande. Veuillez réessayer plus tard.

string.name: wp_home_information_from
string.context: Title for happy together pop up about where your item feed card is coming from.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_title
string.context: Title for switch organization section. This sections shows different organizations the user can either directly jump to the remote org or go to the remote org's login screen.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_go_to_login
string.context: Button to go to the remote organization's login page.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_go_to_self_account
string.context: Button to go to the remote organization's account within your context.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_go_to_sign_up
string.context: Button to go to the remote organization's signup page.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_go_to_subject_account
string.context: Button to go to the remote organization's account for your subject.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_failed_org_text
string.context: Text shown to user when a link has failed to get data from the remote organization.

resources.string: Désolé, nous rencontrons actuellement des difficultés à obtenir des données de cet établissement.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_ax_show_accounts_at_org
string.context: This is the accessibility text for the care everywhere logo. When clicking this it will show what accounts are at the remote organization.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_ax_org_name_with_alerts
string.context: This is the accessibility text for the remote organization. This will also indicate the org has alerts. %1$@ is the remote org name.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_ax_org_name_failed_link
string.context: This is the accessibility text for the remote organization. This will also indicate the org's link failed. %1$@ is the remote org name.

resources.string: %1$@. Nous rencontrons actuellement des difficultés à obtenir des données de cet établissement.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_ax_org_name_signup_needed
string.context: This is the accessibility text for the remote organization. This will also indicate signup is needed at the org. %1$@ is the remote org name.

resources.string: %1$@. Une connexion est nécessaire pour cet établissement.

string.name: wp_switch_accounts_payer_only_org_text
string.context: Text shown to user when a linked org is a payer only organization.

string.name: wp_app_review_warning_message_p1
string.context: A portion of a warning message to show to patients before submitting an app review to inform them of the publicity and behavior of app reviews. %1$@ is the name of the app store depending on platform (Google Play Store for Android and App Store for iOS).

resources.string: Cet avis sera visible à tous dans %1$@. Veuillez partager uniquement les informations dont vous acceptez la publication.

string.name: wp_app_review_warning_message_p2
string.context: A portion of a warning message to show to patients before submitting an app review to inform them of the publicity and behavior of app reviews. %1$@ is the mobile apps branded name.

resources.string: L\'avis concerne uniquement l\'application %1$@. Veuillez contacter votre prestataire pour donner votre avis sur vos soins.

string.name: wp_app_review_warning_message_p3
string.context: A portion of a warning message to show to patients before submitting an app review to inform them of the publicity and behavior of app reviews.

resources.string: Vous pouvez uniquement envoyer un avis. Si vous en avez déjà rédigé un, vous ne pourrez pas en envoyer un autre.

string.name: wp_app_review_ios_store_name
string.context: The name of the app store on iOS.

string.name: wp_app_review_android_store_name
string.context: The name of the app store on Android.

string.name: wp_epicfun_mychart_hint
string.context: Prepends fun fact text segments that are hints and link to activities, (E.g.) MyChart Hint: MyChart is an ...

string.name: wp_epicfun_close
string.context: Close button text shown to close out of the fun fact view

string.name: wp_epicfun_mychart_developed_by_epic
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that gives insight into what Epic is. Paried with an Epic Logo Sign Image.

resources.string: MyChart est une application développée par une entreprise appelée Epic, qui développe également le logiciel de dossier santé électronique utilisé par votre prestataire de santé.

string.name: wp_epicfun_electronic_health_record
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that gives insight into your Electronic Health Record. Paired with an image of a clinician.

resources.string: Votre dossier santé électronique dans Epic aide les cliniciens à vous fournir des soins en fonction de vos antécédents médicaux uniques. Cela vous permet également de gérer vos soins ici dans MyChart.

string.name: wp_epicfun_epic_story
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that compares Epic's EHR to epic tales. Paired with an Epic image.

resources.string: \"Epic\" en anglais est la traduction d\'\"épopée,\" un récit glorieux des événements d\'une nation. Comme les histoires célèbres de l\'Iliade et de l\'Odyssée, votre dossier de santé électronique dans Epic fait la chronique de vos soins de santé au fil du temps.

string.name: wp_epicfun_millions_of_patients
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that highlights the widespread use of MyChart. Paired with a heart image.

resources.string: Près de 190 millions de patients dans le monde utilisent MyChart pour gérer leurs soins.

string.name: wp_epicfun_mychart_country
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that compares MyChart's user base to the population of countries. Paired with a MyChart image.

resources.string: Si MyChart était un pays, ce serait le 8ème plus grand pays au monde.

string.name: wp_epicfun_share_everywhere
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains Share Everywhere feature. Paired with a Share Everywhere image.

resources.string: Vous pouvez utiliser Share Everywhere pour donner un accès unique à votre dossier médical à n\'importe quel clinicien dans le monde.

string.name: wp_epicfun_madison
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that provides historical information about Epic. Paired with a capital image.

resources.string: Epic a été fondé en 1979 à Madison, dans le Wisconsin aux États-Unis. Depuis, Epic a élu domicile dans les environs de Madison.

string.name: wp_epicfun_basement
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that shares the humble beginnings of Epic. Paired with an apartment image.

resources.string: Epic a commencé avec trois employés à mi-temps travaillant dans le sous-sol d\'un immeuble à Madison, dans le Wisconsin aux États-Unis.

string.name: wp_epicfun_secure_data_sharing
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains secure data sharing with Epic. Paired with an Epic Sign image.

resources.string: Grâce à Epic, votre établissement de santé peut partager en toute sécurité vos données de santé lorsque vous recevez des soins dans un nouvel établissement.

string.name: wp_epicfun_request_medical_record
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains how to request medical records via MyChart. Paired with a request copy image.

resources.string: Vous pouvez utiliser MyChart pour demander une copie de votre dossier médical et d\'autres documents et les télécharger dès qu\'ils sont disponibles.

string.name: wp_epicfun_farm
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that describes Epic's campus as a working farm. Paired with a cow and goat image.

resources.string: Le campus d\'Epic à Verona, dans le Wisconsin aux États-Unis, est également une ferme en exploitation. Environ un tiers des terres est utilisé pour la culture, les vaches et les moutons.

string.name: wp_epicfun_document_care_decisions
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains how to document care decisions in MyChart. Paired with a decisions image.

resources.string: Vous pouvez utiliser MyChart pour documenter les décisions concernant vos soins si un membre de votre famille, un médecin ou une autre personne désignée doit agir en votre nom.

string.name: wp_epicfun_wait_list
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains the wait list feature in MyChart. Paired with a calendar image.

resources.string: Vous devez attendre un rendez-vous? Vous pouvez vous inscrire sur la liste d\'attente et recevoir une notification lorsqu\'un rendez-vous se libère plus tôt. En 2023, les établissements ont utilisé MyChart pour voir les patients sur liste d\'attente 47 jours plus tôt en moyenne.

string.name: wp_epicfun_animals
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that describes the animals on Epic's campus. Paired with a donkey image.

resources.string: De nombreux animaux habitent sur le campus d\'Epic - une ferme en exploitation - tout au long de l\'année. Certains, comme l\'âne sur la photo, deviennent populaires auprès du personnel et reçoivent un nom. Nous vous présentons Ralph.

string.name: wp_epicfun_midnight
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that introduces Midnight the cow. Paired with a Midnight image.

resources.string: Il y a quelques années, les vaches habitant sur le campus d\'Epic ont accueilli un nouveau membre dans leur famille. Nous vous présentons Midnight la vache.

string.name: wp_epicfun_cowbikes
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that describes the cow bikes on Epic's campus. Paired with a cow bike image.

resources.string: Il y a des \"vélos vache\" sur le campus d\'Epic pour aider les employés et les visiteurs à se déplacer rapidement. C\'est une manière pour nous de montrer notre attachement aux racines du Wisconsin aux États-Unis, connu pour ses fermes laitières.

string.name: wp_epicfun_ffa
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains how to give family access to MyChart. Paired with a family access image.

resources.string: Vous pouvez autoriser l\'accès à votre compte MyChart à votre soignant et aux membres de votre famille.

string.name: wp_epicfun_slides
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that describes the fun culture at Epic. Paired with a slide image.

resources.string: S\'amuser est au cœur de la culture d\'Epic. En plus de simples escaliers, notre campus comprend quelques tobogans au grand plaisir des visiteurs.

string.name: wp_epicfun_treehouse
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that describes the treehouse on Epic's campus. Paired with a treehouse image.

resources.string: Le campus d\'Epic comporte une cabane dans les arbres construite par le personnel et des étudiants du lycée local. Elle est rudimentaire: pas de chauffage, pas de téléphone, pas de toilettes.

string.name: wp_epicfun_lma
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains how to link MyChart accounts. Paired with a happy together image.

resources.string: Si vous avez des comptes MyChart dans différents établissements, vous pouvez les lier pour afficher des informations telles que les médicaments, les visites, les résultats d\'analyses et les membres de l\'équipe soignante en un coup d\'œil.

string.name: wp_epicfun_update_health_info
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains how to update health information in MyChart. Paired with a clipboard update image.

resources.string: Avant un rendez-vous chez le médecin, vous pouvez utiliser MyChart pour mettre à jour certaines informations de santé, telles que vos allergies et vos médicaments actuels.

string.name: wp_epicfun_global
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that highlights the global use of Epic's software. Paired with a globe image.

resources.string: Les prestataires de santé utilisent le logiciel Epic dans 16 pays.

string.name: wp_epicfun_biometrics
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains biometric login methods for MyChart. Paired with a biometrics image.

resources.string: Utiliser des méthodes de connexion biométriques, comme Face ID ou votre empreinte digitale, pour vous connecter facilement à MyChart. Vous n\'avez pas besoin de saisir votre nom d\'utilisateur et votre mot de passe.

string.name: wp_epicfun_2fa
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains two-factor authentication for MyChart. Paired with a 2FA image.

resources.string: Vous pouvez améliorer la sécurité de votre compte MyChart avec une authentification à 2 facteurs. De cette façon, votre compte est en sécurité si quelqu\'un obtient votre nom d\'utilisateur et votre mot de passe.

string.name: wp_epicfun_geothermal
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that describes the renewable energy sources at Epic's campus. Paired with a flower image.

resources.string: Le campus d\'Epic à Verona, dans le Wisconsin aux États-Unis, tire une grande partie de son énergie de l\'énergie éolienne, solaire et géothermique. Notre système de chauffage et de refroidissement géothermique est l\'un des plus grands au monde.

string.name: wp_epicfun_employee_owned
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that highlights Epic's employee-owned status. Paired with an employee-owned image.

resources.string: Epic est - et restera toujours - une entreprise indépendante détenue par ses employés. De cette façon, nous pouvons continuer à nous concentrer sur les patients et le milieu de la santé, et non sur les actionnaires.

string.name: wp_epicfun_shortcuts
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains how to update shortcuts in MyChart. Paired with a change shortcuts image.

resources.string: Vous pouvez mettre à jour les boutons de raccourci sur la page d\'accueil pour accéder aux ressources que vous utilisez le plus souvent, comme les analyses ou la prise de rendez-vous.

string.name: wp_epicfun_personalize
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that explains how to personalize MyChart with an accent color. Paired with a personalize image.

resources.string: Saviez-vous que vous pouvez choisir votre propre couleur d\'accentuation pour votre compte MyChart?

string.name: wp_epicfun_diversity
string.context: Fun fact easter egg content that highlights the diversity of Epic's staff. Paired with a diversity image.

resources.string: Le personnel d\'Epic vient de plus de 60 pays et apporte une grande diversité d\'identités et d\'expériences.

string.context: Generic Link text for clicking to learn how to do an action.

string.context: Generic Link text for clicking to learn more about an action.

string.context: Link text for documenting care decisions in MyChart.

string.context: Link text for accessing FFA.

string.context: Link text for enabling two-factor authentication in MyChart.

string.context: Link text for updating shortcuts in MyChart.

string.context: Link text for personalizing MyChart with an accent color.
